tip: Exercise regularly: Physical activity can help raise HDL (good cholesterol) and lower LDL (bad cholesterol). Aim for at least 30 minutes of moderate exercise most days of the week.
Eat more fiber: Foods rich in soluble fiber, like oats, beans, and apples, can help reduce LDL cholesterol levels and improve heart health.
Choose healthy fats: Replace saturated fats and trans fats with healthier unsaturated fats found in olive oil, nuts, and fatty fish like salmon.
Limit processed foods: Processed and packaged foods often contain unhealthy fats and high sodium levels, which can negatively affect cholesterol levels.
Stay hydrated: Drinking plenty of water throughout the day helps maintain good circulation, which supports heart health and cholesterol management.
